individual_metadata.synopsis: Florrick is with her Flaming Fist troops in Haven. As you approach, they are furiously trying to put a plan together to rescue Ravengard. The curse is one thing, but Ketheric is invincible. They can't just storm the place. And even if they could, they would execute the prisoners if the alarm was raised - including the Grand Duke.Florrick turns to you, incredibly grateful that we have made it so far. She implores you to work with Jaheira for her rescue efforts, but tells you your priority is clear: Duke Ravengard. He must be returned to the city - it will not survive his absence.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Load SCL_Main_AIn the debug book, select Act 2 Setup > Go Offroad > Florrick > Is saved from Waukeen's Rest.Go to Florrick in Last Light. (-62; 156)

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The provided data contains only a single session (with an empty name). Without additional sessions to compare against, no ordering constraints (predecessor-successor relationships) or mutual exclusivity conditions can be established.

15.speaker: Manip Vidor
15.text: He still won't speak - just keeps going with the bloody song.

63.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
63.text: Nothing of use on his person?

49.speaker: Manip Vidor
49.text: His original writ of duty - signed by Eltan himself. Fella must be one of the very first Flaming Fist.

71.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
71.text: He must know something. Let's not give up on him yet.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vidor nodes and walks away, leaving conversation.

2.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
2.text: Hells - I know that voice. Wyll? In Tymora's name, what happened to you?

54.speaker: Wyll
54.text: The Hells have had their vengeance - and I doubt they are done with me.

94.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
94.text: Ye gods, fate has no shortage of troubles to burden us with.

92.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
92.text: Wyll? Gods, please, no. The Blade of Frontiers was supposed to be my secret weapon.

11.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
11.text: That eye. In Tymora's name, Wyll? What's happened to you?
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerNodeContext: Notices player suddenly. HAnd to brow in exasperation.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: A devil deal gone horribly wrong.

3.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
3.text: A devil deal? Have you lost your - hm, forget it. Your soul is your own for the dealing. Your father's? That's a different matter.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: A story for another time and another place.

78.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
78.text: Ye gods, fate's found no shortage of troubles to burden us with.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: It's my business, Florrick - not yours.

57.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
57.text: Fine. Gods know I've got enough worries plucking at my nerves.

6.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
6.text: Gods, please, no. You were supposed to be my wildcard.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerNodeContext: Notices player suddenly. HAnd to brow in exasperation.

76.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
76.text: I don't suppose you've found a way into the Towers?

45.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
45.text: Merciful Tymora. That's the first piece of good news I've heard since Elturel, but I'm not pinning all my hopes on you.

14.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
14.text: We're almost sure Duke Ravengard is held within the towers, but this curse presents a formidable obstacle.

85.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
85.text: I trust that you will do everything you can to free the duke. But in case you don't find a way, I'll be heading to Baldur's Gate to seek reinforcements.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I have. But there was no sign of the duke.

72.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
72.text: It's impressive that you reached Moonrise at all, even more impressive that you're alive to tell the tale. But it's not the tale I wanted to hear.

43.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
43.text: Keep on searching. I'll be heading to Baldur's Gate to seek reinforcements.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: What's with the fellow in the cot?

70.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
70.text: Isobel cleared this place, and he just... appeared. We think he was staying at the inn when the curse fell - which means he's been trapped inside for a century.

38.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
38.text: It beggars belief he's alive at all.

40.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
40.text: Hopefully he'll come 'round. Tell us something useful about getting through the shadows. Right now he seems to have little more to him than a refrain from some song or other.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: What can you tell me about Isobel?

33.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
33.text: Cleric of Selûne - she's got a room upstairs if you want to meet her. Just don't interrupt her while she's doing whatever it is that keeps this place shadow-free.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I doubt that man will recover any time soon.

47.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
47.text: I doubt it too. But I haven't given up hope.

69.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
69.text: Unfortunately, I won't be here when he comes around. I'm heading to Baldur's Gate, to seek reinforcements.

7.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
7.text: The Council sent a carrier pigeon with news that the city has been dealing with Absolutist attacks. The Steel Watch is holding strong.

51.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
51.text: I'll request that Lord Gortash send some of them to aid in the fight against Moonrise. The curse won't harm them.

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: Holy shit. That's my old boss - the guy who sold me to Zariel!

77.speaker: Wyll
77.text: Gortash, as in Enver Gortash? Last I knew, he was a minor player in city affairs.

60.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
60.text: A lot's changed since you left Baldur's Gate, Wyll. Gortash has gained considerable influence since then.

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *Gortash. Your old boss - the man who sold you to Zariel. It seems he's calling himself 'lord' these days.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *You know the name Gortash. A counsellor with considerable influence on Baldurian industry and politics... but he is no Lord.*

9.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
9.text: The Steel Watch are the future of warfare. Gondian automatons that can be sent into battle without risking any lives - except those of our enemies.

39.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
39.text: Lord Gortash had only completed work on the prototypes before Ravengard and I left for Elturel, but even they were formidable.

29.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
29.text: With the Steel Watch at our backs, we could storm the tower whatever Ketheric throws at us, I'm sure of it.

32.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
32.text: I'll do my best but there's every chance I'll fall to the curse or the cult before I reach the city.

30.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
30.text: So don't count on me, assume no aid is coming.

19.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
19.text: Don't count on me, and assume no aid is coming. Work with Jaheira. That Harper's mind is as sharp as her blade. Follow her guidance.

27.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
27.text: Farewell. We'll meet again, gods willing.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: You're leaving? While Duke Ravengard is still captive in Moonrise?

36.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
36.text: My role here is limited. I can be put to better use convincing the council to send reinforcements to help rescue the duke.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Lord Gortash? I thought he was no more than a counsellor.

17.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
17.text: Lord Gortash is the man responsible for the creation of the Steel Watch. It's no wonder he earned the title.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: How do you expect to reach Baldur's Gate?

50.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
50.text: I half-expect to die trying, but I prefer that to standing on the sidelines while you risk everything.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I'd like to talk to him.

82.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
82.text: Wouldn't we all. I'm not even sure he's fully conscious. But feel free to say hello. Maybe a new face will inspire him.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Are the Flaming Fist just going to stand around here?

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I have no intention of heading there.

5.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
5.text: I understand. These cursed lands present a formidable obstacle.

89.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
89.text: We believe the cultists have taken your father to Moonrise Towers. I don't suppose you've found a way in?

62.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
62.text: We believe the cultists have taken Duke Ravengard to Moonrise Towers. I don't suppose you've found a way in?

16.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
16.text: The journey back to Baldur's Gate won't be easier, but your task here is harder still. Tymora be with you.

20.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
20.text: That eye. In Tymora's name, Wyll? What's happened to you?

68.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
68.text: Gods, please, no. You were supposed to be my wildcard.
